intro: Echinospermum nervosum, commonly known as the hairy echinochrome, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves with prominent veins, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and attract various pollinators. Echinospermum nervosum is often found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
